title.narrative: QUALITY AND INCLUSIVE ECE SERVICES

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, more young children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from learning, nurturing, care and development at home and in their communities.

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to work closely with MoNE, municipalities and non-governmental implementing partners to expand the provision of flexible alternative Early Childhood Education (ECE) services, including playsets, storybooks and other materials, were provided to more than 50,000 ;;vulnerable children across 20 provinces and 1,727 volunteer teachers (1,580 female teachers and 147 male teachers) were trained to foster play-based learning. Through Sesame Workshop awareness raising material on COVID19 was disseminated to 5,712 families and 7,246 children, with the intent to promote good practices and to cope with anxiety and fear and encourage play and learning. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:21/01/2022

Status of action plan for scale-up of the provision of pre-primary education through alternative models., Text

baseline.value: Action plan for scaling up the provision of pre-primary education through alternative models is not available/inexistent.

target.value: 2025:80% of the action points included in the plan are under implementation.

actual.value: 2021:The ToR for conducting an ECE/pre-primary education investment case study has been prepared and under review, and an ECE expansion action plan will be developed as part of the ECE investment case study by December 2022.

title.narrative: Status of action plan for scale-up of the provision of pre-primary education through alternative models., Text

baseline.value: Action plan for scaling up the provision of pre-primary education through alternative models is not available/inexistent.

target.value: 2025:80% of the action points included in the plan are under implementation.

actual.value: 2021:The ToR for conducting an ECE/pre-primary education investment case study has been prepared and under review, and an ECE expansion action plan will be developed as part of the ECE investment case study by December 2022.

title.narrative: Status of early learning standards and curriculum for school readiness., Text

baseline.value: Standards and curriculum for 3 to 6 years are inadequate to improve school readiness.

target.value: 2025:Revised standards and curriculum are implemented in 20 provinces.

actual.value: 2021:The curriculum (MoNE calls it preprimary education programme) for 3-6-year-old children has been revised and is under review at MoNE.
